title: Federal Decree-Law No. (41) of 2024 On the Issuance of the Personal Status Law
full_text:
Federal Decree-Law No. (41) of 2024 On the Issuance of the Personal Status Law

We, Mohammed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE;

Upon reviewing the Constitution;
Federal Law No. (1) of 1972 concerning the Competences of Ministries and the Powers of Ministers, as amended;
Federal Law No. (28) of 2005 concerning Personal Status, as amended;
Upon the proposal of the Minister of Justice and the approval of the Cabinet;

Have promulgated the following Decree by Law:

Article One: Scope and Application
The Personal Status Law attached to this Federal Decree-Law shall be implemented, and the provisions thereof shall apply to all matters covered by the articles therein contained. If the judge does not find a provision, he/she shall render a judgement in conformity with the Islamic Law "Sharia", provided that the most appropriate solutions shall be chosen as interest requires.

Article Two: Applicable Laws
The provisions of the Civil Procedure Law, the Evidence Law in Civil and Commercial Transactions, and the Civil Transactions Law shall apply to matters not specifically stated in the herewith-attached law.

Chapter One: General Provisions

Article (1) Scope of Application of the Law
1. The provisions of this Law shall apply to UAE citizens if both parties of the relationship or one of them is Muslim.
2. The provisions of this Law apply to non-Muslim UAE citizens unless they have provisions specific to their sect and religion or they agree to apply another law permitted by the legislation in force in the State.
3. The provisions of this Law shall apply to non-UAE citizens unless one of them insists on applying his/her law or any other law that has been agreed to be applied, as permitted by the legislation in force in the State.

Article (2) Calculating the Durations
The Gregorian calendar shall be adopted for the durations mentioned in this Law unless otherwise stated.

Article (3) Courts' Competence
1. The courts of the State shall be competent to consider cases related to Personal Status issues filed against citizens and foreigners who have a domicile, place of residence, or place of work in the State.
2. The court, within whose jurisdiction falls the respondent's domicile, place of residence or place of work, shall be competent.

Chapter Two: Marriage Provisions

Article (16) Definition and Purpose of Marriage
Marriage is a legal contract between a man and a woman, the purpose of which is to establish a family based on tranquility, compassion, and mercy.

Article (17) Elements of Marriage Contract
The marriage contract consists of offer and acceptance expressed in any wording that indicates the intent of marriage according to the custom.

Article (18) Eligibility for Marriage
Eligibility for marriage is attained by reaching the age of eighteen (18) Gregorian years for both males and females, and being of sound mind.

Scope of Application of the Law - The provisions of this Law shall apply to UAE citizens if both parties of the relationship or one of them is Muslim.
Calculating the Durations - The Gregorian calendar shall be adopted for the durations mentioned in this Law unless otherwise stated.
Courts' Competence - The courts of the State shall be competent to consider cases related to Personal Status issues.

title: Federal Decree-Law No. (14) of 2024 On Traffic Regulation
full_text:
Federal Decree-Law No. (14) of 2024 On Traffic Regulation

We, Mohammed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE;

Have promulgated the following Decree by Law:

Chapter One: Definitions and General Provisions

Article (1) Definitions
For the purposes of this Decree-Law, the following terms shall have the meanings assigned to them:
1. Traffic: The movement of pedestrians, animals, and vehicles on roads.
2. Vehicle: Any means of transportation that moves on roads by mechanical power or otherwise.
3. Driver: Any person who drives, guides, or is in actual control of a vehicle.
4. Road: Any public or private way designated for the movement of vehicles and pedestrians.

Article (2) Scope of Application
The provisions of this Decree-Law shall apply to all roads in the State, whether public or private, unless otherwise stated.

Chapter Two: Traffic Violations and Penalties

Article (10) Speed Violations
Any driver who exceeds the maximum speed limit shall be subject to a fine and traffic points as specified in the schedule attached to this Decree-Law.

Article (11) Driving Under Influence
It is prohibited to drive a vehicle while under the influence of alcohol or narcotics. Violators shall be subject to imprisonment and/or fine.

Article (12) Reckless Driving
Any person who drives a vehicle in a reckless manner that endangers the lives or property of others shall be punished by imprisonment and/or fine.

Chapter Three: Vehicle Registration and Licensing

Article (20) Vehicle Registration
All vehicles operating on the roads of the State must be registered with the competent authority and bear valid license plates.

Article (21) Driver's License
No person shall drive a vehicle on the roads of the State without holding a valid driver's license issued by the competent authority.
